intro: Calobota multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered calobota, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with opposite, elliptical leaves that are often hairy. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring and summer. The plant is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and savanna habitats.
